thread.title: DOEL launches credit-card sized feature phone for Rs 1,999
thread.title_full: DOEL launches credit-card sized feature phone for Rs 1,999

title: DOEL launches credit-card sized feature phone for Rs 1,999
text:
DOEL launches credit-card sized feature phone for Rs 1,999 DOEL launches credit-card sized feature phone for Rs 1,999 By January 18, 2017 “The DOEL ET 106 feature phone resembles a credit card and weighs just 50 grams” 
Domestic manufacturer DOEL has launched a new feature phone called the ET 106. The brand is marketing it as a ‘smartphone mate’. It works as a secondary device to make or receive calls via a connected smartphone over Bluetooth. The handset can also work as a standalone feature phone as it comes with a SIM card slot. One of the highlights of the device is its design, which resembles a credit card and weighs just 50 grams. 
The brand’s press release mentions that the DOEL ET 106 can accept 4G SIM cards as well, which is a first. You will be able to receive calls using a telecom operator’s 4G SIM card on this device, but data or VoLTE can’t be used, so it’s pointless. 
As far as the other specs go, the DOEL ET 106 features a 1.8-inch TFT display, a touch keypad, FM Radio, Bluetooth v3.0, multi-language support and micro-USB. It is powered by a 500mAh battery, which is rated to deliver four hours of talk time and four days of standby time. 
The DOEL ET 106 feature phone is officially priced at Rs 3,000. However, the phone is up for grabs on Amazon India for as low as Rs 1,999. We have contacted the company to reveal how the 4G functionality works on this device. We will update you as soon as we get a response from DOEL. Facebook Comments
